ctl:test.name: getmap:main
ctl:test.ctl:assertion: The GetMap request behaves properly.

xsl:when.ctl:message: Error: No Named layers in capabilities XML.

ctl:test.name: getmap:bbox
ctl:test.ctl:assertion: The BBOX parameter behaves properly.

ctl:test.name: getmap:bgcolor
ctl:test.ctl:assertion: The BGCOLOR parameter behaves properly.

ctl:test.name: getmap:crs
ctl:test.ctl:assertion: The CRS parameter behaves properly.

ctl:test.name: getmap:exceptions
ctl:test.ctl:assertion: The EXCEPTIONS parameter behaves properly.

ctl:test.name: getmap:format
ctl:test.ctl:assertion: The FORMAT parameter behaves properly.

ctl:test.name: getmap:layers
ctl:test.ctl:assertion: The LAYERS parameter behaves properly.

ctl:test.name: getmap:styles
ctl:test.ctl:assertion: The STYLES parameter behaves properly.

ctl:test.name: getmap:transparent
ctl:test.ctl:assertion: The TRANSPARENT parameter behaves properly.

ctl:test.name: getmap:width-and-height
ctl:test.ctl:assertion: The WIDTH and HEIGHT parameters behaves properly.

ctl:test.name: getmap:bbox-direct
ctl:test.ctl:assertion: When a GetMap request contains a layer whose BoundingBox is contained directly in the layer, then the response is valid.

xsl:when.ctl:message: No named layers with a BoundingBox contained directly in the layer.

ctl:test.name: getmap:bbox-inherited
ctl:test.ctl:assertion: When a GetMap request contains a layer whose BoundingBox is inherited from a parent layer, then the response is valid.

xsl:when.ctl:message: No named layers with an inherited BoundingBox.

ctl:test.name: getmap:bbox-below-scale
ctl:test.ctl:assertion: When a map is requested where the scale is below the appropriate range as indicated by the MinScaleDenominator element, then the response is not an exception.
ctl:test.ctl:comment: Only tested if CRS:84 is available

xsl:when.ctl:message: No named CRS:84 layers with a minimum scale denominator greater than 0.

ctl:test.name: getmap:bbox-above-scale
ctl:test.ctl:assertion: When a map is requested where the scale is above the appropriate range as indicated by the MaxScaleDenominator element, then the response is not an exception.
ctl:test.ctl:comment: Only tested if CRS:84 is available

xsl:when.ctl:message: No named CRS:84 layers with a maximum scale denominator.

ctl:test.name: getmap:bbox-exponential
ctl:test.ctl:assertion: When a GetMap request uses exponential notation values for the BBOX parameter, then the response is valid.

xsl:if.ctl:message: Error: The image produced using exponential notation in the bbox is not the same as the image produced without using exponential notation.

ctl:test.name: getmap:bbox-pixel-interpretation
ctl:test.ctl:assertion: The server interprets the bounding box as going around the "outside" of the pixels of the image rather than through the centers of the border pixels.
ctl:test.ctl:comment: The test verifies that none of the border pixels in the image returned are white

ctl:test.name: getmap:bbox-minx-gt-maxx
ctl:test.ctl:assertion: When the BBOX parameter's minimum X is greater than the maximum X, then the server throws an exception.

ctl:test.name: getmap:bbox-minx-eq-maxx
ctl:test.ctl:assertion: When the BBOX parameter's minimum X is equal to the maximum X, then the server throws an exception.

ctl:test.name: getmap:bbox-miny-gt-maxy
ctl:test.ctl:assertion: When the BBOX parameter's minimum Y is greater than the maximum Y, then the server throws an exception.

ctl:test.name: getmap:bbox-miny-eq-maxy
ctl:test.ctl:assertion: When the BBOX parameter's minimum Y is equal to the maximum Y, then the server throws an exception.

ctl:test.name: getmap:bbox-no-overlap
ctl:test.ctl:assertion: When a request contains a Bounding Box whose area does not overlap at all with the BoundingBox advertised, then the server returns empty content.

xsl:when.ctl:message: No named CRS:84 layers that don't cover the entire world.

ctl:test.name: getmap:bbox-outside-crs
ctl:test.ctl:assertion: When a request contains a Bounding Box that falls outside of the defined range of the CRS, then the server returns empty content for the area.

xsl:when.ctl:message: No named CRS:84 layers.

ctl:test.name: getmap:no-bgcolor
ctl:test.ctl:assertion: When a GetMap request is made with no BGCOLOR parameter, then areas which are not covered contain white (0xFFFFFF) pixels.

ctl:test.name: getmap:blue-bgcolor
ctl:test.ctl:assertion: When a GetMap request is made with a BGCOLOR parameter, then areas which are not covered are set to the value of BGCOLOR.

ctl:test.name: getmap:crs-direct
ctl:test.ctl:assertion: When a GetMap request contains a single layer and a CRS where the CRS is contained directly in the layer in the capabilities document, then the response is valid.

xsl:when.ctl:message: Error: No Named layers with a CRS contained directly in the layer.

ctl:test.name: getmap:crs-inherited
ctl:test.ctl:assertion: When a GetMap request contains a single layer and a CRS where the CRS is inherited from a parent layer in the capabilities document, then the response is valid.

xsl:when.ctl:message: Error: No Named layers with a CRS inherited from a parent layer.

ctl:test.name: getmap:invalid-crs
ctl:test.ctl:assertion: When the CRS parameter in a GetMap request contains a CRS that is not valid for any of the layers being requested, then the server shall throw a Service Exception (code=InvalidCRS).

ctl:test.name: getmap:each-layer-crs-combination
ctl:test.ctl:assertion: For {$layer}, each of its CRSs is valid.

ctl:test.name: getmap:each-crs
ctl:test.ctl:assertion: For {$crs}, when the CRS parameter is set to that CRS, then the response is valid.

xsl:when.ctl:message: No Named layers for CRS .

ctl:test.name: getmap:exceptions-default
ctl:test.ctl:assertion: When an exception is raised without specifying the EXCEPTIONS parameter, then the response is a valid exception with a Content-type header of text/xml.

xsl:if.ctl:message: Content-type header was instead of text/xml.
The results do not validate against the exceptions schema.

ctl:test.name: getmap:exceptions-xml
ctl:test.ctl:assertion: When an exception is raised and EXCEPTIONS=XML, then the response is a valid exception with a Content-type header of text/xml.

xsl:if.ctl:message: Content-type header was instead of text/xml.
The results do not validate against the exceptions schema.

ctl:test.name: getmap:exceptions-inimage-mime
ctl:test.ctl:assertion: When an exception is raised and EXCEPTIONS=INIMAGE, then the Content-type of the return header is the same as the FORMAT requested.

ctl:test.name: getmap:exceptions-blank-red
ctl:test.ctl:assertion: When an exception is raised and EXCEPTIONS=BLANK, TRANSPRENT=FALSE, and BGCOLOR=0xFF0000, then the image returned contains only red pixels.

ctl:test.name: getmap:exceptions-blank-transparent
ctl:test.ctl:assertion: When an exception is raised and EXCEPTIONS=BLANK and TRANSPRENT=TRUE, then the image returned contains only transparent pixels.

ctl:test.name: getmap:exceptions-blank-mime
ctl:test.ctl:assertion: When an exception is raised and EXCEPTIONS=BLANK, then the Content-type of the return header is the same as the FORMAT requested.

ctl:test.name: getmap:invalid-format
ctl:test.ctl:assertion: When a GetMap request contains a Format that is not advertised, then the server throws a Service Exception (code=InvalidFormat).

ctl:test.name: getmap:each-format
ctl:test.ctl:assertion: For {$format}, when the FORMAT parameter is set to that format, the MIME type of the response matches that format.

ctl:test.name: getmap:two-layers
ctl:test.ctl:assertion: When a GetMap request contains two valid layer names (separated by a comma), then the response is valid.

ctl:test.name: getmap:three-layers
ctl:test.ctl:assertion: When a GetMap request contains three valid layer names (separated by commas), then the response is valid.

ctl:test.name: getmap:invalid-layer
ctl:test.ctl:assertion: When the layer in a GetMap request is invalid, then the response is an exception (code=LayerNotDefined).

ctl:test.name: getmap:first-layer-invalid
ctl:test.ctl:assertion: When a GetMap request contains two layers where the first is invalid and the second is valid, then the response is an exception (code=LayerNotDefined).

ctl:test.name: getmap:second-layer-invalid
ctl:test.ctl:assertion: When a GetMap request contains two layers where the first is valid and the second is invalid, then the response is an exception (code=LayerNotDefined).

ctl:test.name: getmap:each-layer
ctl:test.ctl:assertion: For {$layer}, when the LAYERS parameter is set to that layer name, the MIME type of the response is valid.

ctl:test.name: getmap:styles-direct
ctl:test.ctl:assertion: When a GetMap request contains a single layer and a single style where the style is contained directly in the layer in the capabilities document, then the response is valid.

xsl:when.ctl:message: No named layers with a style contained directly in the layer.

ctl:test.name: getmap:styles-inherited
ctl:test.ctl:assertion: When a GetMap request contains a single layer and a single style where the style is inherited by the layer in the capabilities document, then the response is valid.

xsl:when.ctl:message: No named layers with a style inherited from a parent layer.

ctl:test.name: getmap:two-styles
ctl:test.ctl:assertion: When a GetMap request contains two valid layers and two valid styles (separated by a comma), then the response is valid.

xsl:when.ctl:message: No named layers with a style.

ctl:test.name: getmap:three-styles
ctl:test.ctl:assertion: When a GetMap request contains three valid layers and three valid styles (separated by commas), then the response is valid.

xsl:when.ctl:message: No named layers with a style.

ctl:test.name: getmap:invalid-style
ctl:test.ctl:assertion: When a GetMap request contains an unadvertised Style, then the response is an exception (code=StyleNotDefined).

ctl:test.name: getmap:styles-default-single-layer
ctl:test.ctl:assertion: When a GetMap request contains a single layer and a null style value (as in "STYLES="), then the response is valid.

ctl:test.name: getmap:styles-default-multiple-layers
ctl:test.ctl:assertion: When a GetMap request contains multiple layers and requests all layers to be shown in the default style by using a single null value (as in "STYLES="), then the response is valid.

ctl:test.name: getmap:styles-default-commas
ctl:test.ctl:assertion: When a GetMap request contains multiple layers and requests all layers to be shown in the default style by using null values between commas (as in "STYLES=,,,"), then the response is valid.

ctl:test.name: getmap:styles-some-default
ctl:test.ctl:assertion: When a GetMap request contains multiple layers and a mixture of named and default styles (as in "STYLES=style1,,style2,,"), then the response is valid.

xsl:when.ctl:message: No named layers with a style.

ctl:test.name: getmap:first-style-invalid
ctl:test.ctl:assertion: When a GetMap request contains two layers, where the first style is not valid and the second style is, then the response is an exception (code=StyleNotDefined).

xsl:when.ctl:message: No named layers with a style.

ctl:test.name: getmap:second-style-invalid
ctl:test.ctl:assertion: When a GetMap request contains two layers, where the first style is valid and the second style is not, then the response is an exception (code=StyleNotDefined).

xsl:when.ctl:message: No named layers with a style.

ctl:test.name: getmap:each-style
ctl:test.ctl:assertion: For {$style}, when the STYLES parameter is set to that style name, the MIME type of the response is valid.

xsl:when.ctl:message: No named layers with a style contained directly in the layer.

ctl:test.name: getmap:transparent-default
ctl:test.ctl:assertion: When a GetMap request is made with no TRANSPARENT parameter and a FORMAT that supports transparency over a layer that is not opaque, then the response contains no transparent pixels.

ctl:test.name: getmap:transparent-false
ctl:test.ctl:assertion: When a GetMap request is made with TRANSPARENT=FALSE and a FORMAT that supports transparency over a layer that is not opaque, then the response contains no transparent pixels.

ctl:test.name: getmap:transparent-true
ctl:test.ctl:assertion: When a GetMap request is made with TRANSPARENT=TRUE and a FORMAT that supports transparency over a BBOX that is not completely covered, then the response contains transparent pixels.

ctl:test.name: getmap:transparent-opaque-layer
ctl:test.ctl:assertion: Clients may request TRANSPARENT=TRUE on a layer that is opaque.

xsl:when.ctl:message: No named opaque layers.

ctl:test.name: getmap:large-size
ctl:test.ctl:assertion: When a request is made for a large map (1024x768 or largest map supported), the image returned is exactly the size requested.

xsl:when.ctl:message: Error: Could not read the image size.
Requested a x map, but got a x map.

ctl:test.name: getmap:small-size
ctl:test.ctl:assertion: When a request is made with WIDTH=8 and HEIGHT=5, the image returned is exactly the size requested.

xsl:when.ctl:message: Error: Could not read the image size.
Requested a x map, but got a x map.

ctl:test.name: getmap:layerlimit
ctl:test.ctl:assertion: If the service advertises a LayerLimit, it can handle a GetMap request that includes that many layers.
ctl:test.ctl:comment: Multiple instances of the same layer are used to come up with enough layers to test this.
